title: Beta Launch Plan for the New Web App
description_html:
Welcome to the collaborative document for the Beta Launch Plan! This document outlines the strategy, timeline, and deliverables for the beta launch of our new React-based web app.

Table of Contents

  1. Introduction

  2. Key Goals

  3. Launch Requirements

  4. Timeline

  5. Post-Launch Objectives

Introduction

The beta launch serves as the foundation for rolling out our new web app. It focuses on engaging early adopters while ensuring critical features are ready and stable for public use.

Our Mission

To deliver a seamless user experience by addressing performance issues and showcasing core functionalities during the beta phase.

Key Goals

  • Stability: Ensure a reliable experience for beta users.

  • Feedback: Gather actionable input to improve the app before the full launch.

  • Core Features: Focus on critical functionality like ticket creation and SLA calculations.

Launch Requirements

  • API Optimization: Address performance issues with the SLA matrix and ticket submission endpoints.

  • UI Simplification: Finalize designs for the beta version.

  • Marketing Alignment: Coordinate messaging and assets with the marketing team.

Timeline

Week 1: Final Preparations

Focus on addressing remaining blockers and preparing marketing materials.

Week 2: Beta Rollout

Launch the beta to selected users and monitor for stability.

Week 3: Feedback Analysis

Collect and review user feedback for implementation.

Week 4: Iteration

Make necessary adjustments based on feedback.

Post-Launch Objectives

  • Iterate on beta feedback to refine the product for the full launch.

  • Begin discussions around containerization for Kubernetes deployment.

Technical Notes

For developers integrating API updates, hereâ€™s a sample code snippet for the SLA matrix query:

async function fetchSLA(clientId) {\n  const response = await fetch(`/api/sla/${clientId}`);\n  return await response.json();\n}
